remarks: Given a differentiable function ` F ` , with finite limit of the derivative at ` A ` the derived function ` H ` has a limit at ` 0 ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
fourierdlem60.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem60.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem60.altb $e |- ( ph -> A < B ) $.
fourierdlem60.f $e |- ( ph -> F : ( A (,) B ) --> RR ) $.
fourierdlem60.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. ( F limCC B ) ) $.
fourierdlem60.g $e |- G = ( RR _D F ) $.
fourierdlem60.domg $e |- ( ph -> dom G = ( A (,) B ) ) $.
fourierdlem60.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. ( G limCC B ) ) $.
fourierdlem60.h $e |- H = ( s e. ( ( A - B ) (,) 0 ) |-> ( ( ( F ` ( B + s ) ) - Y ) / s ) ) $.
fourierdlem60.n $e |- N = ( s e. ( ( A - B ) (,) 0 ) |-> ( ( F ` ( B + s ) ) - Y ) ) $.
fourierdlem60.d $e |- D = ( s e. ( ( A - B ) (,) 0 ) |-> s ) $.
fourierdlem60 $p |- ( ph -> E e. ( H limCC 0 ) ) $.
$d A s $.
$d B s $.
$d D s $.
$d E s $.
$d F s $.
$d G s $.
$d N s $.
$d Y s $.
$d ph s $.
